results.title: That's the price
results.creator_credit: Michael Scott, William Canning and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Two points of view concerning what the infusion of industrial capital meant to two dying coal towns in southeastern British Columbia. The film shows what happened when an American corporation came to the twin towns of Natal and Michel with a contract for millions of tons of coking coal for the steel mills of Japan. From what is seen and said in this film, industrial growth has its price, especially with regard to the ecology of the region.

results.title: That's surfing
results.brief_description: This comprehensive documentary looks at Australia’s long running love affair with the ocean and in particular, with surfing. The evolution of the modern surfboard is traced, as well as the emergence of surfing films, music, magazines and surfwear fashion industries. We see the surfboard manufacturing industries that have emerged in coastal towns such as Torquay where surfer-craftsmen experiment in their eternal quest for the perfect board. The development of the Australian surfing subculture is shown, from the influential U.S. surfers who arrived at the 1956 Olympic Games with their Malibu boards, to the female surfers in the 60’s who were largely disregarded unless they were tandem surfing with male partners. This culture is not only embraced by groups of mates who tour beaches in their panel vans but increasingly by the professional surfers who move around the world touring circuits from the Seychelles to Bali, and take out world titles in Hawaii. Historic clashes surfers have had with authorities are presented, as well as music clips of Australian surfing songs from Little Pattie, Col Joye, The Delltones, Normie Rowe and Johnny O’Keefe. The program is a blend of historical surfing footage, interview clips and cameo appearances from most of Australia’s surfing greats from the 1950’s through to the 1990’s including Midge Farrelly, Nat Young, Layne Beachley, Kelly Slater and Mark Occhilupo.

results.title: Malaysia: sparrow with sparrow, raven with raven
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, John Temple and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Asian insight”.
A look at the historical and cultural background of Malaysia. Religion and politics play an important part in the life style of the people. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Thailand - do good receive good, do evil receive evil
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, John Temple, ABC, Film Australia and University of Queensland Press
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Asian insight”.
A look at the historical and cultural background of Thailand - this film attempts to address racist preconceptions about Thai people and their beliefs and rituals. Concentrates on two elements that affect all Thais: Buddhism and the role of the monarchy. It points out how the Monks appear to be losing their leadership roles as Thai society becomes more urbanised and how the Government is attempting to inform the Monks about social change so they don’t lose their place in society. Includes one or two scenes of violence (burning bodies, slaughter etc.) from newsreels. Presented by John Temple.
results.title_for_label: Thailand - do good receive good, do evil receive evil
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arch Nicholson, John Temple, ABC, Film Australia and University of Queensland Press

results.title: That's Democracy (Captioned)
results.brief_description: A seven part program designed to give an overview of our electoral system and its development. Commencing with an outline of the principles of democracy, the programs proceed to trace the history of Government in Australia, discuss the different levels of Government and examine the role of political parties, the voting system, the conduct of elections and the use of the referendum in changing the Constitution.

results.title: Japan: the bamboo bends and does not break
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, John Temple, ABC and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Asian insight”.
Provides insight into the historical and cultural background of Japan, drawing attention to the sense of duty and obligation held by the Japanese in ways that are different from people in the West. Photography by Dean Semler. Unit Manager: Damien Parer.

results.title: That's dancing!
results.creator_credit: Jack Haley, David Niven Jr and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A collection of fifty famous dancers from the world of film, ballet and Broadway are presented in musical sequences ranging from the romantic ballroom dances of Fred Astaire and Ginger Rogers to the electrifying streetgate ballet of “West Side Story”. Highlights the classical brillance of Mikhail Baryshnikov and performances by Busby Berkeley and Michael Jackson.
